name: Account Login Failure Anomaly
description: An anomalously large number of login failures from an internal source IP address to an internal destination IP address was observed for an account

name: AWS - Malicious Host Access
description: AWS activity was detected from a source with a negative reputation

name: AWS Access Key Created
description: An AWS API key was created for a user

name: AWS CloudTrail Important Change
description: An AWS trail was disabled, deleted, or changed

name: AWS Config Disabling Channel/Recorder
description: An AWS config service was disabled

name: AWS Console Successful Logins Outside the US
description: A successful login outside the US was detected for the following AWS user.

name: AWS IAM S3Browser User or AccessKey Creation
description: The S3 browser utility was detected creating IAM User or an AccessKey

name: AWS Identity Center Identity Provider Change
description: A change in the AWS Identity Center identity provider was detected

name: AWS Not MFA Authenticated
description: A successful AWS login occurred without MFA verification

name: AWS SecurityHub Findings Evasion
description: SecurityHub findings were modified.

name: Azure - Successful Login Outside the US
description: A successful login outside the US was detected for the following Azure user.

name: Azure AD Apps Modified To Allow Multi-Tenant Access
description: Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure Active Directory) observed an application being modified to allow multi-tenant access. Check with the organization to be sure this was expected.

name: Azure AD Custom Domains Changed
description: Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure Active Directory) observed a custom domain being changed. Check with the organization to be sure this was expected.

name: Azure AD Risk Detection
description: Azure AD reported risky sign in activity from the indicated user

name: Azure AD Sign in from AzureHound
Azure User Added to Global Admin Group
description: An Azure user was added to the Global Admin group in your environment

name: Bloodhound and Sharphound Hack Tools Detected
Box - Change Admin Role
description: A Box admin role was changed in your environment

name: Box - Content Workflow Policy Violation
description: A Box Work flow policy violation was detected in your environment

name: Box - Information Barrier Disabled
description: A Box Shield information barrier was deactivated

name: Box - Successful Login Outside the US
description: A Box user was seen logging in outside of the United States

name: Conditional Access Policy Deleted
description: An Azure Conditional Access policy was deleted

name: Consent to Suspicious Application
description: A user granted consent to an application that is a known suspicious OAUTH client, indicating potential malicious activity

name: Data Exfiltration to Text Storage Sites and Cloud Storage
Data Ingestion Anomaly for Network and Security Sensors
Device Registration Azure Risk Correlation
description: A device was registered to a user following a risky sign-in via Azure AD

name: DNS Query to TOR Proxy Domain
Duo Login Outside the US
description: A successful login outside the US was detected for the following Duo user.

name: Duo User Bypass Status Update
description: A Duo user was added to bypass status, allowing the user to login without MFA

name: Exploited C&C Connection
mitreTechnique: XDR Command and Control Connection Exploitation

name: External Account Login Failure Anomaly
description: An anomalously large number of user login failures was observed for an account. Check with the user.

name: External Credential Stuffing
description: An anomalously large amount of username/password testing was observed on AWS, Okta, or Windows. Check the activity after successful logins, and consider blocking the source IP addresses.

name: External Protocol Account Login Failure Anomaly
description: An anomalously large number of login failures over SMB or FTP was observed. Check with the user.

name: External User Login Failure Anomaly
description: An anomalous number of login failures was observed for one of the following applications: SSH, SMTP, FTP, RDP, SMB, databases, Active Directory, Office 365, Okta, AWS CloudTrail, or Google Workspace. For Okta, an anomalous number of multi-factor authentication (MFA) failures was observed. Check with the user.

name: File Action Anomaly
description: Actions, such as move, copy, delete, or change attribute, were taken on a file or files an anomalous number of times. Investigate the actions and the user to see if this is expected

name: File Creation Anomaly
description: A file or files were created an anomalously large number of times. Check with the user to see if this is expected

name: FortiManager Potential Vulnerability
description: Activity related to exploitation of CVE-2024-47575, was detected. This may indicate potential RCE attempts from the source host

name: Google Workspace Application Access Level Modified
description: A Google Workspace application access level was modified by the indicated user.

name: Google Workspace Application Removed
description: A Google Workspace application was removed by the indicated user

name: Google Workspace Assign Role
description: A Google Workspace user was assigned another user a new role..

name: Google Workspace Create User
description: A Google Workspace user was created.

name: Google Workspace Deny Access Request
description: A Google Workspace access request was denied

name: Google Workspace Granted Domain API Access
description: An API access service account was granted domain authority

name: Google Workspace MFA Disabled
description: MFA was disabled for a Google Workspace user account

name: Google Workspace Move User To Organizational Unit
description: A Google Workspace user was moved to an organizational unir.

name: Google Workspace Role Modified or Deleted
description: A Google Workspace role was modified or deleted.

name: Google Workspace Role Privilege Deleted
description: A Google Workspace role privilege was deleted.

name: Google Workspace Suspend User
description: A Google Workspace user was suspended.

name: Google Workspace Unassign Role
description: A Google Workspace User unassigned another user from their role.

name: Google Workspace User Deleted
description: A Google Workspace user was deleted in your environment.

name: Google Workspace User Granted Admin Privileges
description: A Google Workspace user was granted Admin privileges within the environment.

name: GSuite - Account Security Settings Disabling
description: Gsuite account security settings were disabled

name: Gsuite - Successful Login Outside the US
description: A successful login outside the US was detected for the following Gsuite user.

name: GSuite - Two Factor Auth Failure
description: A Google Workspace user failed two factor authentication during sign-in attempt

name: Inbox Rule Azure Risk Correlation
description: A new inbox rule has been created following a suspicious sign in attempt categorized by Azure AD

name: Inbox Rule Created After Login Correlation
description: An inbox rule was created shortly after a successful login. This is commonly detected when user accounts are compromised to maintain persistence. Verify with the user if this is valid activity

name: Internal Account Login Failure Anomaly
description: An anomalously large number of login failures from an internal source IP address to an internal destination IP address was observed for an account. Check with the user.

name: Internal Credential Stuffing
description: An anomalously large amount of username/password testing was observed on an internal Windows authentication service. Check the activity after successful logins, and consider blocking the internal source IP addresses.

name: Internal Protocol Account Login Failure Anomaly
description: An anomalously large number of login failures between internal IP addresses over SMB or FTP was observed. Check with the user.

name: Internal User Login Failure Anomaly
description: An anomalous number of login failures between internal IP addresses was observed for one of the following applications: SSH, SMTP, FTP, RDP, SMB, databases, Active Directory, Office 365, Okta, AWS CloudTrail, Google Workspace, Salesforce, or Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure Active Directory). Check with the user.

name: Jumpcloud Command Run
description: A Jumpcloud command run execution was detected in your environment

name: Jumpcloud Login Outside the US
description: A successful login outside the US was detected for the following Jumpcloud user.

name: LastPass API Secret Regenerated
description: Lastpass reported that the API Secret was regenerated

name: LastPass Deactivated User
description: Lastpass activity shows the following user was deactivated, verify if this was expected activity

name: LastPass Deleted Sites
description: A site was deleted for a LastPass user

name: LastPass Employee Account Deleted
description: Lastpass reported the following user account was deleted

name: LastPass Master Password Changed
description: The master password was changed for LastPass

name: LastPass Multiple Failed Login Attempts
description: Multiple login failures  were detected from the listed LastPass account

name: Mass Download by a Single User
description: SecurityComplianceCenter identified a user downloading an anomalously high number of files.

name: MFA Registration Azure Risk Correlation
description: MFA Registration was initiated for an account that was recently detected as a risky sign-in via Azure AD

name: Microsoft Entra Application Configuration Changes
description: The Microsoft Entra Application Configuration Changes rules are used to identify suspicious Microsoft Entra application configuration changes. Any one or more of these will trigger the Microsoft Entra Application Configuration Changes alert type.

name: Microsoft Entra Changes to Device Registration Policy
description: The Microsoft Entra Changes to Device Registration Policy rules are used to identify suspicious Microsoft Entra changes to device registration policy. Any one or more of these will trigger the Microsoft Entra Changes to Device Registration Policy alert type.

name: Microsoft Entra Changes to Privileged Account
Microsoft Entra Changes to Privileged Role Assignment
description: The Microsoft Entra Changes to Privileged Role Assignment rules are used to identify suspicious Microsoft Entra changes to privileged role assignment. Any one or more of these will trigger the Microsoft Entra Changes to Privileged Role Assignment alert type.

name: Microsoft Entra Domain Federation Settings Modified
description: The Microsoft Entra Federation Modified rules are used to identify suspicious Microsoft Entra federation modified activity. Any one or more of these will trigger the Microsoft Entra Federation Modified alert type.

name: Microsoft Entra Guest User Invited By Non Approved Inviters
description: The Microsoft Entra Guest User Invited by Non-Approved Inviters rules are used to identify suspicious Microsoft Entra guest user invited by non-approved inviters. Any one or more of these will trigger the Microsoft Entra Guest User Invited by Non-Approved Inviters alert type.

name: Microsoft Entra Hybrid Health AD FS New Server
Microsoft Entra Hybrid Health AD FS Service Deleted
Microsoft Entra ID Discovery Using AzureHound
Microsoft Entra Owner Removed from Application
Microsoft Entra PIM Setting Changed
description: The Microsoft Entra PIM Setting Changed rules are used to identify suspicious Microsoft Entra PIM setting changed. Any one or more of these will trigger the Microsoft Entra PIM Setting Changed alert type.

name: Microsoft Entra Privileged Account Assignment or Elevation
description: The Microsoft Entra Privileged Account Assignment or Elevation rules are used to identify suspicious Microsoft Entra privileged account assignment or elevation. Any one or more of these will trigger the Microsoft Entra Privileged Account Assignment or Elevation alert type.

name: Microsoft Entra Suspicious Changes to Conditional Access Policy
Microsoft Entra Unusual Account Creation
description: The Microsoft Entra Unusual Account Creation rules are used to identify Microsoft Entra unusual account creation activity. Any one or more of these will trigger the Microsoft Entra Unusual Account Creation alert type.

name: Multiple Login Failures from One Source (Destination IP)
Multiple Login Failures from One Source (Source IP)
Multiple Login Failures from One Source (Workstation)
Multiple Users Deleted
description: Multiple windows users (5+) were deleted within a 30 minute time frame were deleted in the environment

name: O365 - A potentially malicious URL click was detected
description: O365 reported that a user clicked a potentially malicious URL.

name: O365 - Creation of forwarding or redirect rule
description: A forwarding or redirect rule was enabled by the following user

name: O365 - Elevation of Exchange admin privilege
description: A user was assigned admin permissions in your Exchange environment

name: O365 - Malware campaign detected after delivery
description: SecurityComplianceCenter reported a potential malware campaign after delivery.

name: O365 - Malware campaign detected in SharePoint and OneDrive
O365 - Phish delivered due to an IP allow policy
O365 - Successful Login Outside the US
description: A successful login outside the US was detected for the following O365 user.

name: O365 - Suspicious email sending patterns detected
O365 - Tenant restricted from sending email
description: O365 has restricted a tenant from sending emails due to anomalous activity.

name: O365 - Unusual external user file activity
O365 - Unusual volume of external file sharing
description: O365 reported a spike in external file sharing for the indicated user.

name: O365 - User impersonation phish delivered to inbox or folder
O365 - User restricted from sending email
description: O365 has restricted the following user from sending email due to anomalous activity.

name: Office 365 Content Filter Policy Changed
description: The Microsoft Exchange content policy was changed. An overly permissive content policy can allow spammers to send your organization unwanted email. Make sure this change was expected.

name: Office 365 File Sharing with Outside Entities
description: An Office 365 account shared multiple files with entities outside of the organization. Check with the user to make sure this was expected.

name: Office 365 Malware Filter Policy Changed
description: The Microsoft Exchange malware filter policy changed. An overly permissive malware filter policy can allow attackers to send malicious attachments to your organization. Make sure this change was expected.

name: Office 365 Multi-factor Authentication Disabled
description: O365 has reported that the indicated user had MFA disabled for the account.

name: Office 365 Multiple Files Restored
description: Office 365 observed that multiple files were restored in a short period. Check with the user.

name: Office 365 Password Policy Changed
description: Office 365 identified a change to your organization's password policy, which is uncommon. Make sure this was expected.

name: Okta - Attempt to Deactivate Okta Application
description: An attempt was made to deactivate an Okta application, verify with the user that generated this event to determine if this was authorized.

name: Okta - Attempt to Deactivate Okta Policy
description: An attempt was made to deactivate an Okta policy

name: Okta - Attempt to Modify Okta Policy
description: An attempt was made to modify an Okta policy in the environment

description: Detects login to OneLogin without applying MFA

name: Potential Jumpcloud Radius Brute Force Attempt
Potential LDAP Nightmare Exploitation
description: Detects exploitation attempt of CVE-2024-49113 known as LDAP Nightmare, based on "Application Error" log where the faulting application is "lsass.exe" and the faulting module is "WLDAP32.dll".

Potential Raspberry Robin CPL Execution Activity

description: The session ID for the user was detected from two IP's, this could indicate that the user has had the sign in token stolen by a malicious actor.
